huntBios.GENERAL_INFORMATION: Please become familiar with the boundaries of this hunt. Many of the roads have several names, but roads used in the hunt boundary description were found from the "streets with relief" basemap in the hunt planner.
huntBios.SAFETY_CONS: Be prepared for rough roads and rocky trails. Always carry plenty of water and tell someone where you are hunting. Cell service is very limited.
huntBios.WEATHER_CONS: The weather on this hunt unit can vary dramatically during the hunting season.  Be prepared for variable conditions. Check weather forecasts often. Be prepared for muddy road conditions.
huntBios.MANAGEMENT_OBJ: 60~1500~1100~~~~~~~~~~For more detailed information on population and objective data please see the Big Game Annual Report Page.
huntBios.BIOLOGIST_NOTES:
Pronghorn on this unit have changed their distribution in response to past hunting efforts to lower the population to objective. Many pronghorn are now found in timbered areas where they traditionally would not be. The objective of this hunt is to move hunting pressure to the pronghorn in these timbered areas while allowing population growth of pronghorn in their core areas of habitat.

This will be a challenging hunt. The pronghorn are very wary of motorized vehicles and will often move to cover before they are in view. Leaving vehicles to hike and glass is recommended. Although there are many sources of water, hunting water sources can be an effective strategy. Hunters need to be very aware of the hunt boundaries as pronghorn will move between areas within this hunt boundary to areas not included.

Groups of pronghorn have been seen north of Highway 24 near Fish Lake, Logging Grove, Big Lake, Coyote Hollow, and Pollywog Lake. Any meadows or openings in these areas are likely places to find pronghorn.

huntMaster.NOTES:
Baiting big game for the purposes of hunting is now illegal in Utah.
Click here for more information.

The use of all trail cameras (including both non-handheld transmitting and non-transmitting devices) in the harvest or to aid in the harvest of big game is prohibited between July 31 and Dec. 31. Click here for more information.
huntMaster.HARVEST_REPORTING: REQUIRED: click here or call 1-800-221-0659 to report your harvest. You must report your harvest, even if you did not take an animal, within 30 days of the season end date that is printed on your permit; failure to do so may result in you not being able to apply for big game species in subsequent years. Submitting teeth or other biological samples from your animal, or having your animal checked by a DWR representative or CWMU operator does NOT fulfill your mandatory harvest reporting requirement.

huntBoundaryInfos.CAMPGRND_INFO: Please refer all questions about camping and campgrounds to the Richfield and Loa field offices of the BLM and USFS.
huntBoundaryInfos.ATV_VEH_ACCESS:
There is an expansive road and trail system on this unit. All roads and ATV trails on this unit are managed by the BLM, USFS, Sevier, Wayne, Piute and Garfield counties. Most Travel regulations are covered in their Travel Management Plans.  Please direct questions regarding which roads and trails ATVs can be operated to the Fish Lake National Forest, Richfield and Loa offices. BLM offices are in Richfield and Loa. The USFS has a travel map that covers most of this area. 
http://www.fs.usda.gov/main/fishlake/maps-pubs
huntBoundaryInfos.BOUNDARY_DESCRIPTION: Garfield, Piute, Sevier and Wayne countiesâ€”Boundary begins at I-70 and US-89 north of Sigurd; south on US-89 to SR-24; south on SR-24 to SR-25; east on SR-25 to Fishlake Road(aka Deadman rd); south on this road to SR-24; east on SR-24 to North Mountain Road (aka FR 380); north on this road to FR 046 (aka Vance Road through Cedarless Flat); north-east on FR 046 through Cedarless Flat to the Freemont River Road (Hwy 25); south on this road to SR-72; south on SR-72 to SR-24; south on SR-24 to Hatchery Road; west on this road to Smooth Knoll Road (road from Bicknell to Escalante); south on this road to NF-157 (towards Pelham Hollow), west on NF-157 to NF-571 (continuing past Antelope Springs), west on NF-571 to NF-139; north on NF-139 (Big Swell through Death Hollow) to NF-85; north-west on NF-85 to Wildcat Road; north on this road to Parker-Antimony Road (Dry Wash); west on this road to the Widtsoe-Antimony road (SR 22); south on this road to SR-12; east on SR-12 to the Burr Trail at Boulder; east on the Burr Trail to the Notom road; north on the Notom road to SR-24; east on SR-24 to the Caineville Wash road; north along this road to the Cathedral Valley road; west on this road to Rock Springs Bench and the Last Chance Desert road; north on this road to the Blue Flats road; north and east on this road to the Willow Springs road; north on this road towards Windy Peak and the Windy Peak road; west on this road to SR-72; north on SR-72 to I-70; west on I-70 to US-89 north of Sigurd. EXCLUDES ALL NATIONAL PARKS.
